definition: to leave home (to become a Buddhist monk or nun)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Finally he ordained also representing her sister's a loving to forest.
sentences.chinese: 最后他出家也代表着她对林妹妹的一片钟情。

sentences.english: In the Twelve Maidens in Jinling, Miaoyu is the only nun.
sentences.chinese: 妙玉是金陵十二钗中唯一的出家人。

sentences.english: Li Shutong becomes a monk and stays at the Hupao Monastery with Hongyi as his Buddhist name.
sentences.chinese: 李叔同到杭州虎跑寺出家为僧，法号弘一法师。

sentences.english: Monks and nuns may wear their robes in keeping with their respective traditions.
sentences.chinese: 出家僧侣需要穿僧袍保持优良传统。

sentences.english: Monks are wise, they don't worry about money.
sentences.chinese: 出家人是聪明的，因为他们不在乎身外之物。

sentences.english: While monastics are nourished mentally with Buddha Dharma every day, enjoying real bliss.
sentences.chinese: 出家人每天用佛法滋养内心才是真正的快乐。

sentences.english: Elder sister, that family at see you.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐，那个出家人在看你呢。

sentences.english: So left-home people, wherever they may be, must sternly guard their precepts.
sentences.chinese: 所以，出家人处处要严守戒律。

sentences.english: When Hu was six or seven years old, he asked his father and mother if he could become a monk.
sentences.chinese: 胡六七岁的时候，问他父母可不可以让他出家为僧。

sentences.english: Why do they choose to be nuns?
sentences.chinese: 为什么她们选择出家呢？

sentences.english: What was the monastic name of the late art educator Li Shutong?
sentences.chinese: 已故艺术教育家李叔同出家后的法号是什么？

sentences.english: Gentleman will be able to learn to rule the country at home.
sentences.chinese: 故君子不出家而成教于国。

sentences.english: Chinese parents don't want their kids to be monks, ' he explained.
sentences.chinese: 叶琛说，中国的父母不想让他们的孩子出家。

sentences.english: That was the first he saw a left home person.
sentences.chinese: 那是他第一次看到一个出家人。

sentences.english: I have just switched to the profession of a teacher and quite lack experience in teaching work.
sentences.chinese: 我刚半路出家来当教师，还没有什么教学经验。

sentences.english: Worse still is an evil recluse who is repulsively loathsome to gods and men alike.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，一个邪恶的出家人则为人神所共同嫌恶。
